definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: In UK the law derives its authority, expressly or impliedly, from Parliament.
sentences.chinese: 在英國，法律的權威，明示或着暗示地，來自於議會。

sentences.english: To participate in the discussion forums, users are required to disclose their name and email address.
sentences.chinese: 要參與論壇，用戶需要明示其姓名和電子信箱地址。

sentences.english: The revocation or renunciation of an agency may be made expressly or impliedly by conduct.
sentences.chinese: 廢止或斷絕代理，可以明示或暗示處理。

sentences.english: According to Relevance Theory, reading comprehension is an ostensive - inferential and dynamic process.
sentences.chinese: 閱讀理解是一個明示一推理的動態認知過程。

sentences.english: As one form of communication, translation is primarily an ostensive inferential cognitive process.
sentences.chinese: 而翻譯作爲一種交際行式是一個明示推理的認知過程。

sentences.english: In this process, the speaker first sets up in his activity an ostensive stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 在這一過程中，說話人首先在其活動中設置明示刺激。

sentences.english: Specify the real or implied commitment that was broken.
sentences.chinese: 詳細陳述不守約的明示的或暗示的承諾。

sentences.english: Please verify which one is more accurate .
The express agreement of parties overcomes the law.
sentences.chinese: 雙方當事人的明示協議勝過法律。

sentences.english: Never ride elevators that are clearly marked with un-safe condition.
sentences.chinese: 嚴禁乘坐明示處於非安全狀態下的電梯。

sentences.english: The brochure is not an implied or express contract.
sentences.chinese: 本冊並非一份默認或明示的合同。

sentences.english: The parol evidence rule applies to evidence as to the express terms of a contract are.
sentences.chinese: 口頭證據規則適用於確定合同的明示條款的證據。

definition: to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
must not/may not/not to be allowed/cannot
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
